intro: Carmichaelia diffusa, commonly known as the broad-leaved kōwhai, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often blooming in spring. The leaves are broad and lance-shaped, with a distinctive waxy coating that helps reduce water loss in its native environment.
